title: Introduction to Rafsi
goal: Learn what rafsi are and why gismu have short combining forms.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Tanru grouping review:

barda blanu gerku (default) = ?
barda blanu bo gerku = ?

(Answers: (barda blanu) gerku, barda (blanu gerku))

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
brivla x1 is a predicate word with meaning x2 predicate word
cmavo x1 is a structure word of class x2 structure word

What Are Rafsi?

Rafsi are short combining forms of gismu. Each gismu has 2-5 rafsi that can be used to build compound words.

Why Rafsi Exist

Gismu are exactly 5 letters. Combining them directly would create very long words:

klama + bajra = klamabajra (10 letters!)

Rafsi make compounds shorter:

klam + baj = klambaj (7 letters)

Rafsi Forms

Each gismu can have:

  • CVC form (3 letters): e.g., klam from klama
  • CCV form (3 letters): e.g., kla from klama
  • CVV form (3 letters): e.g., kai from karce
  • CVCC form (4 letters): e.g., brid from bridi
  • CCVC form (4 letters): e.g., bran from branu

Not every gismu has all forms.

Examples

Gismu Some Rafsi
klama (go) klam, kla
bridi (predicate) brid, briv
valsi (word) val, vla
bangu (language) ban, bau

Key Point

Rafsi are short forms used to build compound words. You don't need to memorize all rafsi — dictionaries list them.

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Identify Word Types

Classify each:

  1. klama — gismu, cmavo, or brivla?
  2. .i — gismu, cmavo, or brivla?
  3. cu — gismu, cmavo, or brivla?
  4. gerku — gismu, cmavo, or brivla?
Answers
  1. gismu (and therefore brivla)
  2. cmavo
  3. cmavo
  4. gismu (and therefore brivla)

Note: All gismu are brivla (predicate words). Cmavo are structure words.

Exercise 2: Rafsi Recognition

Which could be rafsi? (3 or 4 letters, specific patterns)

  1. klam — rafsi?
  2. ba — rafsi?
  3. brid — rafsi?
  4. ge — rafsi?
Answers
  1. Yes — CVC pattern, 3 letters
  2. No — only 2 letters (this is a cmavo)
  3. Yes — CVCC pattern, 4 letters
  4. No — only 2 letters (this is a cmavo)

Exercise 3: Use New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a predicate word.
  2. cu is a structure word.
  3. I learn predicate words.
Answers
  1. ti brivla
  2. zo cu cmavo
  3. mi cilre lo brivla

Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "This is a predicate word." → ti brivla
  2. "That is a structure word." → ta cmavo
  3. "klama is a gismu." → zo klama gismu

Summary

You learned about rafsi — short combining forms that make compound words manageable. Each gismu has multiple rafsi.
